alert.note: Alert for Glacier Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 30 at 6:03AM AKST until February 01 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM AKST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Areas Around The Salmon River Near The Gravel Pits, Rink Creek And Wilson Road. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM AKST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 549 AM AKST, river gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain in areas around the Salmon River near the gravel pits, Rink Creek and Wilson Road. Minor flooding is ongoing, especially near the Salmon River. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are possible. - For Salmon River at Gustavus : At 11:15pm the stage was 15.78 feet. Flood Stage is 15.5 feet. Forecast: the river has crested and is receding. Impacts: At 15.5 feet: Water will begin to flow over Wilson and Rink Creek roads and ditches will be full. Roads will be soft in places and travel across these areas will be difficult.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
